intro: Senecio alliariifolius, commonly known as the garlic leaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has basal and upright stems with narrow, grass-like leaves that resemble garlic foliage, hence its common name. Its flowers are typically yellow and are arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. Senecio alliariifolius is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
